DataElement.preferredName: Patient Risk Factor Research Team Identified Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text indicator to signify whether or not any condition that the research team feels will be an endangerment to the patient has been identified.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Risk Factor Research Team Identified
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Anything that increases a person's chance of developing a disease. Some examples of risk factors for cancer include a family history of cancer, use of tobacco products, certain foods, exposure to radiation or cancer-causing agents, and certain genetic alterations._People engaged in research._Two or more people working together._The procedure of having an identity established.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:Anything that increases a person's chance of developing a disease. Some examples of risk factors for cancer include a family history of cancer, use of tobacco products, certain foods, exposure to radiation or cancer-causing agents, and certain genetic alterations.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
Any aspect of an individual's life, behavior, an environmental exposure, or an inborn or inherited characteristic that increases the likelihood of a disease, condition or injury.

Property.preferredDefinition: People engaged in research.:Two or more people working together.:The procedure of having an identity established.

Concepts.definition: Two or more people working together.
The procedure of having an identity established.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator of Yes or No to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated to add NCIt concept relationship. Updated VM Short Name to be the Public ID to be consistent with current convention for VM Short Name - DW 10-03-2022

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
